result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chadwick E Zakrzewski

records.addlTxt:
9:54 AM case called. Defendant Chadwick E Zakrzewski in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Chadwick E Zakrzewski.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with B.H. or their residence.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.  
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

11:13am Defendant Chadwick Zakrzewski appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Zebulon Patek. Attorney Monica Fallon for the State of Wisconsin.  Waives reading of the complaint. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/12/22 at 2:45pm
Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
